text: "Workers of the world, unite!" is a slogan from The Communist Manifesto. It means that the working class should work together to get rid of capitalism and win the class war. == History == The original phrase in German was "Proletarians of all countries, unite!". == In other languages == This slogan was used as a motto by many communist and socialist states during the Cold War. === Motto of the Soviet Union === In each Soviet republic, the same motto was used in the local language. Language Motto Transliteration Used by Abkhaz Armenian Proletarner bolor yerkrneri, miats’ek’! Avar Azerbaijani Bütün ölkələrin proletarları, birləşin! Bashkir Belarusian Praletaryji ŭsich krajin, jadnajciesia! Chechen Chuvash Crimean Tatar Erzyan Estonian Finnish Georgian Proletarebo qvela kveqnisa, sheertdit! Ingush Kabardian Kalmyk Karachay-Balkar Kazakh Barlyq elderdıñ proletarlary, bırıgıñder! Komi Kyrgyz Bardık ölkölordün proletarları, birikkile! Latvian Lithuanian Mari Moksha Ossetian Romanian (Moldovan Cyrillic) Proletari din toate țările, uniți-vă! Russian Proletarii vseh stran, sojedinjajtesj! Sakha Tajik Proletarhoji hamaji mamlakatho, jak şaved! Tatar Turkmen Ähli ýurtlaryň proletarlary, birleşiň! Udmurt Ukrainian Proletari vsich krajin, jednajtesja! Uzbek Butun dunyo proletarlari, birlashingiz! === Motto of the League of Communists of Yugoslavia === Language Motto Transliteration Macedonian Proleteri od site zemji, obedinete se! Serbo-Croatian / Proleteri svih zemalja, ujedinite se! Slovenian === Motto of other countries === Language Motto Transliteration Used by Chinese Quánshìjiè wúchǎnjiējí hé bèi yāpò de mínzú liánhé qǐlai! Czech German Hungarian Mongolian Oron büriin proletari nar negdegtün! Polish Romanian Slovak Tuvan Pygy delegejniꞑ вroledarlarь polgaş tarladkan araddarь kaddьƶьꞑar! == References == Category:Communism Category:Marxism Category:Mottos
title: Workers of the world, unite!
